My name is Mason and I'm an entrepreneur over here in NYC. I'm currently working on a iOS project and seeking a technical co-founder.

The idea is for a mobile location based app named bonsai. The mission would be to show people how they're connected (digitally) to the people around them.

The concept is to have people sign up for bonsai, plug in their social graphs, twitter, tumblr, facebook, linkedin, etc. Then we can show how you're related to the people around you based on several social graphs.

Example: Mason Levey and John Smith are in the same coffee shop and we could instantly see that we have 4 mutual friends on facebook, 17 of the same followers on twitter, and 8 mutual friends on 4sq, etc.

I have some ideas on how to score/prioritize the Mason and John relationship so you can instantly see how connected we would be based on the bonsai score.

At a high level I'm intrigued with being able to instantly see how I'm digitally connected to people in the real world.

Please let me know if anyone is interested and would like to further discuss.

Thank you, 

Mason
I would love to donate small amount, but thru some kickstarter program.. that way it is good for everyone
Really looking for feedback on the concept as well :)

@mlevey yes I am, interested.. but not sure how serious this will be

There is a big treasure chest hidden in hear, and that's social interactivity. If you can make the service act like a game (Similar to what foursquare does with locations), I think it would skyrocket. But make it for more than just iOS; Android, WP7, Symbian, and WebOS all deserve some love. Even more, perhaps make it a web service that all of these can be integrated into.
Sort of like a social dashboard, where you keep stats on everything going on in Bonsai.
@forwardtwo yeah definitely have to go multi-platform
exactly social anaytics
basically it would turn the entire world into ladies night
Have I mentioned that I'm interested? :)
Definitely sounds like a nice idea. Long term question though: How are you going to make money with it? There it is. Flat out. It's just part of what you should think about.
Make it free for women, but guys have to pay

This sounds like a lovely idea. I do have a couple of questions I would think about first though. Is this not very similar to foursquare applied to social graphs from other services? Granted you take the radius of your social graph a step further but that seems to be of a lot less value than the first step.
Are you going to have to be really careful about broadcasting your friend lists to anyone near you?

I'd be wary if it automatically broadcasts within a given radius.  You should have the user check-in first to foursquare/gowalla/fb places and then have it provide the social graph of their relations to each other.
@m4dhatt3r we should chat can you send me a message at masonlevey@gmail.com

@jonathanbusch @phantomAI  I like the idea of being able to open your bonsai app and it automatically shows how you're connected to people nearby. I think making someone check in adds friction to the process - pros and cons to both I guess.
@jonathanbusch @phantomAI I was not thinking 24/7 background GPS - I was thinking you have to open the app and then Bonsai grabs your location.
@mlevey sounds like a pretty solid idea, I'd recommend finding a good technical co-founder and applying to YC ;)
i've had similar ideas.... would be willing to share some thoughts with you.  sulleleven on gmail
@etmaguire Thanks! please let me know if you think of any good technical co-founders masonlevey@gmail.com
@etmaguire Do you have to code to be accepted into YC?
@etmaguire Love the design of the convore site!

@mlevey thanks for the compliments and no you don't have to code although anything you can add to the actual production of the product would be helpful. There are definitely non-technical founders at YC
